get.summary:
List chat messages for a specific resource with pagination.
Authorization: authenticated user with access to the specified resource.
Resource access is validated based on resource type (MARKET, EVENT, VENDOR).

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description:
- MARKET: Market chat is open for all users to discuss about the market
 - DRAFT_MARKET: Draft market chat is open for market owner and platform owner.
 - VENDOR: Vendor chat is open for vendor (defined by the vendor id) and the market owner
 - EVENT: Event chat is opened for all vendors for the event and the market owner

parameters.name: nextPageToken
parameters.description:
Token provided by the server to retrieve the next page. Use the ID of the
last message from the previous page.

parameters.name: prevPageToken
parameters.description:
Token provided by the server to retrieve the previous page. Use the ID of
the first message from the previous page.

post.summary:
Post a new chat message to a specific resource.
Authorization: authenticated user with access to the specified resource.
Resource access is validated based on resource type (MARKET, EVENT, VENDOR).

delete.summary:
Delete a chat message (moderation action).
Authorization: market owner, event owner, or platform admin/owner only.
Resource ownership is validated based on the message's resource type.

Clear all flags from a chat message (moderation action).
Authorization: market owner, event owner, or platform admin/owner only.
Resource ownership is validated based on the message's resource type.

post.summary:
Flag a chat message as inappropriate.
Authorization: authenticated user with access to the resource where the message was posted.
Platform admins can flag any message regardless of resource access.

Search chat messages across ALL resources with advanced filtering capabilities.
STRICTLY RESTRICTED: platform_admin and platform_owner roles ONLY.
This endpoint provides administrative access to all chat messages system-wide
and bypasses normal resource-based access controls.

EventServiceUpdateEventStateBody.title:
UpdateEventStateRequest is used to change the lifecycle state of an event.
The request includes the event's unique identifier and the desired new state.
Allowed transitions are:
  OPEN -> CLOSED
  CLOSED -> FINALIZED

seller.title: Archive items for this seller number only

includeArchived.title: Include already archived items in the result

untilTimestamp.title: Archive items up to this point in time

items.description: Items being created. Mobile clients should provide item_id and purchase_id for each item.

SoldItemsServiceCreateSoldItemsBody.description:
Request to create sold items for an event.

MOBILE CLIENT USAGE:
1. Generate unique item_id (ULID) for each item before sending
2. Generate common purchase_id (ULID) for all items in same purchase
3. Save items locally before sending (offline-first)
4. Send to server when network available
5. If network fails, retry with same IDs - backend will detect duplicates
6. Handle rejected_items: DUPLICATE_RECEIPT means already saved (safe to mark uploaded)

Example:
{
  "event_id": "evt_abc123",
  "items": [
    {"item_id": "01JHRM8YFZA1B2C3D4E5F6G7H8", "purchase_id": "01JHRM8YFZA1B2C3D4E5F6G7H0", "seller": 42, "price": 50, "payment_method": 1},
    {"item_id": "01JHRM8YFZA1B2C3D4E5F6G7H9", "purchase_id": "01JHRM8YFZA1B2C3D4E5F6G7H0", "seller": 42, "price": 75, "payment_method": 1}
  ]
}

lifecycleState.description:
*
The event’s lifecycle state controls whether the event is open for new transactions.

Although the start and end dates imply a timeline (coming, ongoing, completed),
if the event has not been explicitly closed or finalized, it is treated as OPEN.

Allowed explicit state transitions:
 - OPEN -> CLOSED: When the market owner stops further sales.
 - CLOSED -> FINALIZED: When sold items are archived and payouts are complete.

dateFrom.title: Events that end after this time

dateTo.title: Events that start before this time

searchText.title: Free text search across event name, description, and address fields

marketId.title: Search by market ID to find events for a specific market

lifecycleStates.title: Filter by lifecycle state(s) - e.g., only show OPEN events

v1EventLifecycleState.description:
EventLifecycleState defines the explicit lifecycle state of an event.
Although the event’s start and end dates imply "coming", "ongoing" and "completed"
phases, these are all mapped to the OPEN state. The market owner can explicitly
change an event’s state to CLOSED (to prevent further transactions) and subsequently
to FINALIZED (to archive sold items and mark the event read-only).

 - EVENT_LIFECYCLE_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified state. Must not be used.
 - OPEN: OPEN indicates that the event is open for transactions.
(This includes events that are coming, ongoing, or even completed by date,
provided they have not been explicitly closed.)
 - CLOSED: CLOSED indicates that the market owner has explicitly closed the event,
and no new sold items are accepted.
 - FINALIZED: FINALIZED indicates that the event has been finalized.
Sold items should be archived and the event is rendered read-only.

v1PaymentStatus.title: PaymentStatus is an enum that tell if the vendor has been paid or not

sellerShare.title: Amount that goes to the seller

marketOwnerShare.title: Amount that goes to the market owner

platformProviderShare.title: Amount that goes to the platform provider

totalItems.title: Number of items included in the payout

avatarIconType.description: MIME type of the avatar icon, e.g., "image/png"
avatarIconType.title: Avatar information

avatarIconData.title: Byte array of the avatar icon

v1PlatformAdmin.description:
A PlatformAdmin binding means "this user has the Platform Admin role".
Platform Owner has the same permissions, plus the ability to manage admins.

email.description:
Unique identifier for the profile, used for login.
Must be a valid email address.

v1ReportResourceType.description:
Type of resource that can be reported.

 - REPORT_RESOURCE_TYPE_PROFILE: A user profile
 - REPORT_RESOURCE_TYPE_MARKET: A market listing
 - REPORT_RESOURCE_TYPE_EVENT: An event
 - REPORT_RESOURCE_TYPE_VENDOR: A vendor application or profile

v1ResourceType.description:
- MARKET: Market chat is open for all users to discuss about the market
 - DRAFT_MARKET: Draft market chat is open for market owner and platform owner.
 - VENDOR: Vendor chat is open for vendor (defined by the vendor id) and the market owner
 - EVENT: Event chat is opened for all vendors for the event and the market owner
v1ResourceType.title: Enumerations

vendorPercentage.title: Percentage of revenue given to the vendor

v1SearchChatMessagesRequest.title: Request to search chat messages across all resources with admin privileges

v1SearchChatMessagesResponse.title: Response containing search results for chat messages

itemId.description:
Unique identifier for this sold item. Can be client-generated (ULID) for idempotency.
If empty, server generates a ULID. Mobile clients should always provide this for offline support.

eventId.description: Event this item belongs to. Set by server based on request path.

cashierAlias.description: Alias from the API key used to create this item. Set by server from authentication context.

purchaseId.description:
ULID used to group multiple items into one purchase. Can be client-generated.
All items with the same purchase_id are part of the same transaction.
If all items in request have empty purchase_id, server generates one common ID.
Mobile clients should provide this to maintain purchase grouping across retries.

seller.description: Seller number must be positive and correspond to an approved vendor.

soldTime.description: Timestamp when the item was sold. Cannot be in the future.

v1SoldItem.description:
SoldItem represents a single sold record.

IMPORTANT FOR MOBILE CLIENTS:
To support offline operation and ensure idempotency (safe retries), mobile clients
MUST generate and provide both item_id and purchase_id before sending items to the server.

- item_id: Unique identifier for each item (ULID format). If not provided, server generates one.
  Client-generated IDs enable duplicate detection: if network fails and client retries,
  the backend will reject duplicates (error code: DUPLICATE_RECEIPT) rather than creating duplicates.
  
- purchase_id: Groups multiple items into one purchase (ULID format). All items with the same
  purchase_id are considered part of the same transaction. If not provided by client, server
  generates one common purchase_id for all items in the request.

ULID format: 26 uppercase alphanumeric characters (0-9, A-Z excluding I, L, O, U)
Example: "01JHRM8YFZA1B2C3D4E5F6G7H8"

v1SoldItemErrorCode.description:
- SOLD_ITEM_ERROR_CODE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified error
 - SOLD_ITEM_ERROR_CODE_INVALID_SELLER: Seller not in approved list
 - SOLD_ITEM_ERROR_CODE_DUPLICATE_RECEIPT: MongoDB E11000: duplicate key (event_id, item_id)
v1SoldItemErrorCode.title: Error codes for rejected sold items

v1TicketOrderErrorCode.description:
- SOLD_OUT: Slut på denna typ
 - MAX_PER_VISITOR: Användaren har nått max per person
 - INSUFFICIENT_TICKETS: Det finns färre biljetter än önskat
 - NO_TICKETS_ORDERED: Inga biljetter beställdes
v1TicketOrderErrorCode.title:

empty string → no validation, otherwise must be a valid email
